venue.address_2: (drive all the way to the end of Meadows Lane from Adirondack Loj Rd)
venue.name: South Meadows Campsite

item.description:
ADIRONDACK HP SERIES: Mt. Haystack and Mt. Marcy from The Garden (and camping at the Bouquet River)

EVENT ORGANIZER:
Julie Moran Contact me here: jmmoran @ nycap.rr.com, Mobile 518-281-5882. Please feel free to email me your thoughts about this trip. This is a cross-posted camping event with Hudson Valley Hikers -- this is the travel day -- the hike is the following day. Be sure to review all information below prior to your attending this trip.

PLEASE NOTE: This EVENT has been changed as lingering poor weather means Sunday is the day to go ... sorry for the change guys, but you'll want to enjoy every minute of this great hike under warm summer skies!



Difficulty: About 19.8 Miles, about 4,941' ASL vertical climb; this hike will take about 14 hours to complete. If you choose to do Haystack alone (via the Phelps and State Range trails): 17.2 miles, 3,797' ASL vertical climb. If you choose to do Marcy alone (via the Phelps Trails): 17.4 miles, 3,821' ASL vertical climb.

Meetup Times:

  • Drive time start from Manchester, NH: About four hours, start 3 p.m.
  • Set up camp along Rt. 73 (Boquet River herd path trailhead): 7 p.m.
  • Depart for Garden Trailhead Parking, 6 a.m., 6:30 a.m. START



Google Maps -- CLICK HERE. Estimated Trailhead Directions, Distances (link) from Manchester, NH to the Boquet River herd path trailhead camping area and to the trailhead start at The Garden / Phelps trailhead, near Keene Valley, NY.


ESSENTIALS TO BRING: Flash light AND head lamp, camping supplies, food / snacks / at least 2-3 bottles of water, first aid items, sunscreen; hiking poles may be helpful for this trip. Bring a cell phone if you have one and be sure to give your number to your organizers. If you have a gps bring that as well.


A summertime view (L-R) of Mt. Haystack, Mt. Marcy and Little Haystack.



RESEARCH ESSENTIALS (DESCRIPTIONS, TRIP PLANNERS AND MAPS):

TRIP PLANNER -- CLICK THE "Garden -- Add Marcy" TAB AT THE BOTTOM OF THE PAGE. For hiking Mt. Haystack alone -- CLICK THE "The Garden -- State Range Trail" TAB AT THE BOTTOM. PLEASE view / print / take with you.

TRIP PLANNER -- FOR HIKING MT. MARCY ALONE, CLICK THE "4. RT Phelps Trail" TAB AT THE BOTTOM OF THE PAGE. PLEASE view / print / take with you.

Mt. Haystack:
LINK: Andrew Lavigne
LINK: Adirondack Journey
LINK: Peakbagger
LINK: SummitPost


Mt. Marcy:
LINK: Andrew Lavigne
LINK: Adirondack Journey
LINK: Peakbagger
LINK: SummitPost


NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any challenge hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going and how to get back.





UPDATES (04/04/2010 12 PM):

This trip includes #1 and #3 highest mountains of New York State -- HAYSTACK AND MARCY -- and in my opinion, the two most beautiful mountain summits in the Adirondacks. We'll start at a camping area not far from I-87 / Northway, the Boquet Valley herd path trailhead -- note it's hard to find but it's very private, little used and a good camping area where fires are allowed. It's right off of Route 73 -- you follow a little gravel road up to the left a short way -- use the Google link above to find it! Alternatively, we can get motel rooms in Schroon Lake (the Yellow Coach) or at the Hilltop Motel off Exit 31 -- write me if you have a preference! You can choose to do both these peaks, or one or the other if you wish.

PHOTO CREDITS: Andrew Lavigne (Thank You Andrew!!!)


A summertime view of Mt. Marcy from Mt. Haystack, with the great abyss of Panther Gorge in the foreground.


WEATHER AND OTHER SUDDEN EVENTS CAN CAUSE SUDDEN CHANGES TO OR CANCELLATION OF THIS EVENT. YOU MUST CHECK BACK TO THE MEETUP.COM SITE OFTEN FOR UPDATES.


See you there! Julie.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for the Green Honda Element ...
item.name: ADIRONDACK HP SERIES: Haystack + Marcy! (and camping at South Meadows)
